item.title: Fallout 4 Fan Makes Unique Custom Pip-Boy
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fallout fan creates custom Pip-Boy with vintage car aesthetic that can play tapes- a unique twist on a classic item.
  • The Pip-Boy has evolved throughout the Fallout series but remains a key tool for players to access inventory, map, and level up.
  • Unique homemade Pip-Boy includes functioning components like tape player, knobs, and holding compartment for tools despite vintage design.

A Fallout 4 fan has made a unique custom Pip-Boy that has a vintage car aesthetic and can play inserted tapes. Fallout 4 was released with a special edition that included a Pip-Boy replica, but this one may take the cake.

Since the first Fallout game, the Pip-Boy has been a central feature. While the item has been adjusted over the years, it still serves a similar purpose to the first game. Fallout 1 and 2 have the Pip-Boy 2000, Fallout 3 and New Vegas have the Pip-Boy 3000, Fallout 4 includes the Pip-Boy 1.0 and 3000 Mark 4, and Fallout 76 features the Pip-Boy 2000 Mark 6 . The wearable Pip-Boy computer is usually used to access a player's inventory, view the map, or level up. When the character brings the Pip-Boy into their view, players can get a glimpse at how it looks on their arm. One gamer has decided to make their own Pip-Boy that resembles a 1950s-era car aesthetic.

Related
6 Infamous Pieces of Cut Content in Fallout

Throughout the Fallout franchise, a few interesting pieces of material have ended up on the cutting room floor.

Reddit user Aperturelab1 recently shared a video highlighting their custom Pip-Boy. The clip begins with the gamer approaching their Pip-Boy that's resting on a platform. The Reddit user closes a compartment to show a Fallout logo inside a sun design that sits where the baby blue and white color scheme meets. They then lift the Pip-Boy to closely observe the key details like a screen in the middle of what looks like a car radio with a unique Pip-Boy logo above two knobs, two speakers, and a USB port. The gamer then clamps their arm into the Pip-Boy and loads an RCA tape into its top compartment to play an iconic Fallout song .

What Is This Pip-Boy Made Of?

The tape is played by pressing one of the buttons above the screen, while the volume can be adjusted with the knob on the left of the unit. With the in-game Fallout Pip-Boys , these knobs are also used to navigate the menu which is displayed on the screen. The gamer then turns their arm upside down to show something that resembles a glove compartment that can be used to hold things like a small wrench and a portable soldering iron. There seem to be some dials that don't serve a purpose on the custom Pip-Boy, but add to the vintage car aesthetic. The unit is powered by four 18650 batteries, and it's mostly made of stainless steel.

Despite sharing few similarities with in-game Pip-Boys aesthetically, it features the most important components. The addition of a holding compartment shows another way the portable computer could be used. While this isn't the first fan-made Fallout Pip-Boy , it may be among the most unique.

item.title: Day-One Xbox Game Pass Game Reveals Impressive Launch Sales
item.description:
Highlights

  • Little Kitty, Big City sold 100,000 units in just 48 hours, a major milestone for Double Dagger Studio.
  • Players control a cat in an overwhelmingly large city, engaging in low-stakes mischief along the way.
  • The cozy game, inspired by creator Matt T. Wood's cats, aims to provide stress relief and fun for players.

Little Kitty, Big City has reached a new milestone of 100,000 units in just 48 hours. Releasing day-one on Xbox Game Pass , Little Kitty, Big City is the first game by Double Dagger studio, led by veteran developer Matt T. Wood. Gamers may recognize Wood for his work in the Left 4 Dead series, Portal 2, and Half Life 2 . Fans of these works were excited to see an indie game that would draw upon Wood's level of experience. In addition to his own impressive body of work, Wood used his own cats as inspiration for Little Kitty, Big City.

In Little Kitty, Big City , players take control of a cat that falls from their window and gets lost inside an overwhelmingly large city. The objective is to find your way back home, but there are different tasks and events that the gamers can engage in along the way. Players are free to engage in low-stakes mischief, like figuring out how to make humans trip in Little Kitty, Big City .

Related
Little Kitty, Big City Is Reminiscient of Untitled Goose Game

The chaotic antics shown in Little Kitty, Big City's recent teaser trailer should remind players of the hilarious puzzle game Untitled Goose Game.

Little Kitty, Big City sold 100,000 units in 48 hours. A new post from the game's social media account celebrates this milestone with art and a thank you to players. Little Kitty, Big City released during the same week that Xbox shut down four Bethesda Studios . After the unfortunate news, many fans decided to direct their attention towards the indie gaming space, and this included the day-one Game Pass release. As the team celebrates, Double Dagger has focused its attention on fixing bugs and glitches.

In the same vein as classics like Mario Odyessy , Little Kitty, Big City aims to offer various activities to occupy the player's time. Similarly to Animal Well , another indie that released during the same week, the objectives of this game generally fall under collecting items or interacting with other animals for the fun of it. Players can look for bones in Little Kitty, Big City as they wander around, or try to catch birds and pick up feathers. This cozy game lacks violence, as one of the Double Dagger's stated goals with Little Kitty, Big City is providing an opportunity for stress relief.

Gamers Look Forward to More after Little Kitty, Big City

Generally, players have enjoyed their experiences with this game. In addition to exploring the city, players can become a local celebrity and get humans to take pictures of them in Little Kitty, Big City . Although there appear to be plenty of small moments that add up to lots of fun, some players have mentioned that they wished Little Kitty, Big City lasted longer. It seems that many gamers are eagerly awaiting more fun experiences from Double Dagger.

item.title: Activision Could Be Working on a Brand-New IP
item.description:
Highlights

  • New listing on Activision jobs board sparks rumors of a potential new IP, leading to fan speculation on what it could be.
  • Job posting for Director of Animation Engineering hints at potential live-service game with years of content planned ahead.
  • Speculations range from Call of Duty spin-offs to canceled projects, fueling excitement for what the future holds for Activision.

Rumors of a new IP are growing after a new listing on the Activision jobs board was reported on May 13. Details are difficult to discern from the listing itself, but it hasn't stopped fan speculation as to what this new IP from Activision could possibly be.

Rumors of a new addition to the Call of Duty franchise have been circling since before the listing was reported, but some fans are speculating that it could be an entirely new IP separate from the multimillion-dollar military shooter. Others aren't so sure, citing the recent closure of several studios by Microsoft, and shutdowns rumored yet to come.

Related
Microsoft Could Bring Back These Classic Activision Blizzard Series

Activision Blizzard has a massive catalog of franchises that it's sitting on, but Microsoft could fix that once its acquisition gets approved.

In a job listing posted to Activision's Careers website , Activision is looking for a Director of Animation Engineering "to join the development of a new IP." It goes on to describe one of the responsibilities of the position being to help Activision "Drive the vision and roadmap animation systems for the next 5 years and beyond," which seems to suggest it could be a live-service game with a few seasons of content planned. There aren't many more details in the job posting, other than the need for an experienced animation director who's shipped at least one AAA game and the "Bonus Points" section asking for experience with shader programming languages, animation programming and streaming, and the ability to code reliably and portably.

Fans have a few different ideas about what the mystery product could be, but a few of them are more Call of Duty spin-offs than new IPs. One title floated is known as "Project Devilwood," a code name for a rumored sequel to Call of Duty: Ghosts which released in 2013. The game is expected to be a sequel to the original but still function as a prequel to the greater Modern Warfare storyline. Another option would be "Project Anvil," another code name for a sequel to 2014's Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare . According to developers at Sledgehammer Games, who developed Advanced Warfare , "Anvil" was supposed to release after 2021's Call of Duty Vanguard (also developed by Sledgehammer Games), but the studio was to work on the new Modern Warfare instead.

Old Projects Made New Again?

The listing is also reigniting rumors surrounding Blizzard's canceled survival MMO, along with rumors regarding Infinity Ward's possible FPS RPG, which was also sparked by a job listing. In 2022 it was reported that Infinity Ward's office in Poland was looking for a Narrative Director to help it in world building for an unannounced open-world RPG . Information regarding that particular listing was minimal as well, but the position was filled and the listing taken down shortly after it was widely reported. The cancelation of Blizzard's survival MMO known only as "Odyssey" was reported after Microsoft's acquisition of Activision-Blizzard-King was finalized earlier this year.

As Microsoft acquires more studios and shuts down others, it's difficult to say what its internal plans are, whether this involves a shifting of resources or freeing up more resources for tried-and-true IP. Fans can speculate endlessly over the phrasing of a job listing on LinkedIn, but until someone at Activision comes out with new information, it's anyone's guess as to what project this new Animation Director will lead.

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals New Forms for Legendary Pokemon for Go Fest
item.description:
Highlights

  • Necrozma will make its debut in Pokemon GO during Go Fest 2024, where players can fuse it with Solgaleo or Lunala for powerful forms.
  • Fusion Energy, Solar Fusion and Luna Fusion, earned from raids, is needed to fuse Necrozma with Candy and create the new forms.
  • Fused Necrozma forms, Dusk Mane and Dawn Wings, will improve stats and CP levels, each with a unique Charged Attack.

Niantic has confirmed that the legendary Necrozma along with its Dusk Mane Necrozma or Dawn Wings Necrozma forms will debut in Pokemon GO during the Go Fest 2024 events. The Pokemon Go Fest events are celebrations of Pokemon GO and often include the introduction of the rarest and most powerful Pokemon from the games.

First introduced in Pokemon Ultra Sun and Pokemon Ultra Moon , Necrozma is a unique Pokemon who can merge with the Legendary Pokemon Solgaleo or Lunala creating either Dusk Mane Necrozma or Dawn Wings Necrozma. Niantic has been teasing the release of the latest legendary in Pokemon GO but has now confirmed when players can expect to add it to their Pokedex.

Related
Pokemon GO Players Think Popular Feature From Sword and Shield Could Be Coming

A Pokemon GO leaker alleges that a Pokemon Sword and Shield feature could be seeing a return in the mobile title soon, though there are some concerns.

Necrozma will debut in five-star raids starting with the in-person Pokemon Go Fest events where ticket holders can also encounter its shiny form. If players cannot attend the in-person events in Japan, Spain, and New York City, Necrozma will also be available during the Global Go Fest event scheduled for July 13-14. Once players have caught Necrozma, it can be fused with either Solgaleo or Lunala by using a mixture of Candy and a new type of item known as Fusion Energy.

Fusion Energy comes in two forms: Solar Fusion and Luna Fusion. By defeating Dusk Mane Necrozma in raids, players will earn Solar Fusion, and if Dawn Wings Necrozma is bested, players will be rewarded with Luna Fusion Energy. When a player has 1000 Solar Fusion or Luna Fusion Energy, they can spend 30 Cosmog Candy and 30 Necrozma Candy to create the fused Pokemon. If a player chooses to revert Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma to their original states, there is no additional Candy or Fusion Energy cost.

Requirements to Fuse Necrozma With Solgaleo and Lunala in Pokemon GO

  • Fuse Necrozma with Solgaleo to unlock Dusk Mane Necrozma Form
    • 1,000 Solar Fusion Energy
    • 30 Necrozma Candy
    • 30 Cosmog Candy
    • Dusk Mane Necrozma will know the Charged Attack Sunsteel Strike.

  • Fuse Necrozma with Lunala to unlock Dawn Wings Necrozma Form
    • 1,000 Lunar Fusion Energy
    • 30 Necrozma Candy
    • 30 Cosmog Candy
    • Dawn Wings Necrozma will know the Charged Attack Moongeist Beam.

Using Fusion Energy with Necrozma may seem similar to the Mega Evolution mechanic in Pokemon GO , however, there are key differences. When fused, Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma will gain a boost to their stats and CP levels. Unlike Mega Evolution, each monster will receive a new Charged Attack, and there is no time limit to how long the fusion lasts.

The introduction of Necrozma will no doubt excite players as they gear up for this year’s Go Fest. However, it is still not known if trainers will have to use Cosmog Candy and Necrozma Candy every time they fuse. Another question that has yet to be addressed is if a shiny Solgaleo/Lunala is needed to fuse with a shiny Necrozma. With Pokemon GO Fest 2024 events due to kick off in Japan on May 30, players won’t have to wait long to find out the answer to these questions.

item.title: Pokemon GO Leak Suggests New GO Fest Move Could Surpass Strongest Pokemon In The Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • GO Fest 2024 could change Pokemon GO meta with Dusk Mane Necrozma's Sunsteel Strike move.
  • World of Wonders season had highs and lows in Pokemon GO, with changes affecting user sentiment.
  • Necrozma's moveset in Pokemon GO has surprised the community with powerful charged moves.

Niantic might well be on the way to shake up the Pokemon GO meta with GO Fest 2024, as the debut of Dusk Mane Necrozma could surpass the likes of Shadow Metagross. Shadow Metagross is considered the strongest Steel type in Pokemon GO by a significant margin, but that dominance seems to be under threat with the addition of the charged move Sunsteel Strike.

The ongoing World of Wonders season has been a mixed bag for Pokemon GO fans so far. While it definitely had its highs with events like the April Fools' Day which was widely acclaimed by the fanbase, a series of subsequent updates led to a significant decline in user sentiment towards the game. In particular, the changes made with the Pokemon GO Avatar update are something that didn't go down well in the community. However, it seems like Niantic is on track to reignite the interest of the playerbase with some interesting events.

Related
Pokemon GO Players Think Popular Feature From Sword and Shield Could Be Coming

A Pokemon GO leaker alleges that a Pokemon Sword and Shield feature could be seeing a return in the mobile title soon, though there are some concerns.

The GO Fest is one of the most awaited events every year, and it's been known for quite a while now that Necrozma will be debuting as part of the event in Pokemon GO . However, it is the moveset that has caught the community by surprise. As highlighted in a Reddit post by Pandanoko-Fan137 (via a data mine by PokeMiners ), Dusk Mane Necrozma will be featuring the charged move Sunsteel Strike while Dawn Wings will have Moongeist Beam, both of which reportedly boast a whopping 230 damage.

Dusk Mane Necrozma Might End Metagross' Dominance

The two forms of Necrozma can be obtained in Pokemon GO by fusing it with either Solgaleo or Lunala. To put things into perspective, it surpasses the base power of Aeroblast++, which is the highest in the game. However, that is not what makes the move as lucrative, as Lugia is only viable in certain scenarios. Instead, when Dusk Mane Necrozma is compared to the best Steel type in Pokemon GO , which is Shadow Metagross, it surpasses it quite comfortably.

In fact, its sibling, Dawn Wings Necrozma isn't too far behind in its department as well. When stacked against the best Ghost-type, Mega Gengar, it falls just shy in stats, coming second. However, as the Redditor suggests, despite coming in second, the fact that Dawn Wings is bulkier than Mega Gengar will ensure that it might as well be the go-to Ghost-type Pokemon in Pokemon GO going forward. It should be noted that the duo is still a bit away from outperforming the likes of Rayquaza or Mewtwo, but considering their impressive stats, it doesn't make them any less viable. While fans are already eager to try these new Pokemon out, some are already skeptical about them being banned in GO Battle League considering how powerful they are.
